raw_text:
The One Where Ross Is Fine
Aired: 30/01/2003
Written by: Sherry Bilsing-Graham & Ellen Plummer
Teleplay by: Steven Rosenhaus
Transcribed by: PHDB (phdb2000@hotmail.com) and Sebastiano  (sebapop@libero.it)
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's]
Chandler: Hey!
Ross: Yeah! Yeah! OK! Sure! Look! Can we...can we talk about what  happened here last night?
Chandler: Sure! Just give me a second to get all huffy and weird like  you! Do you believe that who everdid something over here last night did what  they did or didn't do ...I mean come on!!
Ross: OK you...you really don't know what I am talking about?
Chandler: No!
Ross: OK! Last night after the party I saw Rachel kissing that jerk from  her office out on your balcony.
Chandler: Our balcony? Seriously? That's so funny because I told Monica  we should put lights on our balcony. And she said"No, no. It's too cold,  nobody will go out there." And I said "Maybe if we put some light out there they  will"
Ross: Right that's why I came over to talk about. Hum...I saw Rachel  kissing some guy on your balcony,even though there were NO LIGHTS !
Chandler: So are you gonna...talk to her?
Ross: Why...Why should I? I mean if she wants to move on, that's  fine!
Chandler: You know when "That's fine" sounds true when someone yells it  and spits!
Ross: No I'm serious. I mean she wants to date people? Fine! I don't care  but...at least she could have told me. You knowI...I've been putting my life  on hold and just concentrating on Emma but if she wants to go out there kissing  guys shebarely knows, then so will I ! Very funny! Ross is gay! Ah!  Ah!
Chandler: No no no. Good. So you're moving on? Do you have any idea where  you're moving?
Ross: I don't know. I mean I have plenty of opportunity. Just just now  there were some women at the coffee house smiled at me.And then the other  day on the subway a woman "accidentally" sat on my hand.
Chandler: Dude, don't rub my face in your crazy single life!
Ross: Well, and how about this? There is an anthropologist at school who  totally came on to me during the inter-departmentalPotluck dinner.
Chandler: Why did I get married?!


[Opening Credits]

[Scene: Central Perk]
Joey: Hey! Let me ask you guys something. I have a new headshot taken  tomorrow right and the photographer said she thinks Ishould have my eyebrows  waxed. Is that weird for a guy?
Phoebe: Well it depends.
Joey: On...?
Phoebe: On how far along he's in the sex change process!
Monica: No I totally disagree. No I think it's fine for a guy to do  something like that. Such you an actor. Not that you need to,your eyebrows  are...
Joey: Ok! Stop it you guys! Stop staring! You're freaking me out!
Phoebe: Your knuckles are kinda hairy too...
Joey: Oh man! I have to get those done too?!
Phoebe: Wow! Talking about high maintenance
Joey: Hey hey! You dye your hair!
Phoebe: I'm a woman!
Joey: Arghhh! Double standards!
Phoebe: Oh before I forget, are you coming to Mike's piano bar  tonight?
Monica: Only if I don't have to get up and sing.
Phoebe: But everybody sings. It's so much fun! Last time this adorable  old man got out there, forgot all of the words, flipped outand everyone  booed him off the stage. So funny.
Monica: It's just, I'm not good at singing.
Phoebe: Oh! What's the matter? Are you scared? You're afraid I'm a better  singer? You're afraid I'm gonna beat you at singing?
Monica: No no, it's not working on me. Wow! I must be growing up!
Phoebe: OK fine! Please come and support Mike. You don't have to  sing.
Monica: So I don't have to sing and I can just sit there and pass  judgments on others?
Phoebe: While drinking...
Monica: I'm there!
Rachel: Hi guys! Listen I really need your help. I think I did something  really stupid.
Phoebe: Well yes Rachel but you got something so beautiful out  there
Rachel: No not that. I kissed Gavin last night.
Phoebe: Oh my god.
Monica: You kissed him?
Rachel: Yeah. It was after the party, we were on the balcony  and...
Monica: Wait wait wait. I was at home the whole time. How did I missed  that?
Phoebe: It was the end of the party, you were probably ironing wrapping  paper.
Monica: Oh yeah...So how did you end up kissing?
Rachel: You know we were all alone and he was being really nice to me  and, oh and he gave me this scarf...
Monica: I thought you hated him?
Rachel: You know honey, there is a thin line between love and hate, and  it turns out that line...is a scarf!
Monica: So are you thinking of starting up something with this  guy?
Rachel: I don't know. It's so complicated. I work with this guy, you  know, I have the baby, and I have Ross, and I just...I don'tknow what to do  and I have to be at the office and see Gavin in ten minutes.
Monica: Sounds like you need to think about what you want, talk to Gavin,  and you definitely should talk to Ross
Rachel: Or...I could call in sick and not deal with it at all...
Phoebe: Wow! Five-month maternity leave, you're back for four days, kiss  a co-worker, call in sick, they are lucky to have you!!

[Scene: Beauty salon]
Salon girl: Hi
Joey: Hey. I'm here for my eyebrow appointment.
Salon girl: Name?
Joey: Chandler Bing.
Salon girl: Ok. Very good. Have a seat right over here Mr. Bing and Sonia  will be right with you.
Joey: OK Thanks.(Joey touches the hot wax). I touched the  stuff
Sonia: I'll take care of it
Joey: Thanks. Do you get a lot of guys in here?
Sonia: Oh absolutely.
Joey: Oh good...
Sonia: Are you looking to meet somebody?
Joey: All right let's just do this.
Sonia: We'll get to the wax in a minute. First I want to tweeze some of  the strays, ok? This may sting just a little bit...
Joey: Please I have an extremely high threshold...Holly Mother Of God! My  face! My face!! I'm all right! I'm all right!Just a little bit of shock  that's all but I'll be fine you can go again. I'm OK(He tries to avoid the  tweezers) Dammit! Woman!! How Hoooow!
[Scene: Central Perk]
Chandler: Hey it's the most eligible man in NY. How's the moving on  going?
Ross: Not well. I went on the subway again and someone did sit on my hand  but that person was neither female nor wearing pants.
Chandler: Well maybe you're going about this the wrong way. You know I  mean think about it. Single white male, divorced three times,two  illegitimate children. The personal ad writes itself....
Ross: That's funny...Do you think you'll ever work again?
Chandler: What are doing? You know I can only dish it out!
Ross: I can't believe Rachel just moved on and didn't say anything to  me
Chandler: Maybe she didn't move on, you know...maybe that kiss was just  an impulsive one-time birthday thing
Ross: No no, about a month ago she gave her number to some guy in a  bar.
Chandler: Did she go out with him?
Ross: No. When he called, I...I threw the message away.
Chandler: Ah! The high road...
Ross: You know what? Enough! Enough talking! I have to get moving! Hey  check out those two blondes over there!Hey come with me!
Chandler: Are you trying to get everybody divorced?
Ross: You don't have to do anything. It will just be easier if it is the  two of us, like college, remember? You...you break theice with some kind of  jokes so that they know you're the funny one and I swoop in with some  interesting conversation, sothey'll see that I'm the brilliant, brooding,  sexy one...
Chandler: I thought I had to make the jokes!
Ross: Don't you have to be at work?
Chandler: Oh come on! Hello! Hi! My name is Chandler, here's my friend  Ross right here, and we were wondering you know if you're up for it. We only  need six more people for a human pyramid...Swoop!! Swoop!!
Ross: Hum...So...hum...Oh hey I noticed you were reading the  paper...another flood in Europe? Heres a question: "Would you...would you  rather drown or be burnt alive?"
Blonde girl: Sorry...we were just leaving
Chandler: We still got it!

[Scene: Ross']

Rachel: Who is it?
Gavin: Gavin! I brought you some soup.
Rachel: Why?
Gavin: I heard you were sick...
Rachel: Oh! Right! Yeah! Hold on, I'll be just clean up in here a little  bit! Hello Gavin
Gavin: I missed you at work today. How are you feeling?
Rachel: I a not gonna lie to you, I'm pretty sick
Gavin: Oh! Good! Because I was having a totally paranoid moment when I  thought you called in sick to avoid me.
Rachel: Oh no no no
Gavin: So I had fun last night
Rachel: So did I
Gavin: Exactly how contagious is this thing you have? I mean is it a cold  for standing on the balcony or did a monkey bite you?
Rachel: It's just a cold
Gavin: Do you have fever? Let me see. Hum...
Rachel: What? What's the matter?
Gavin: What's Ross doing to you on that picture?
Rachel: Oh he's dusting me with a fossil brush. He thought it would be  funny.
Gavin: Right. Right. Ross. So what's the deal with you guys? I don't want  to get in the middle of anything
Rachel: Oh you're not. You're not gonna get in the middle of anything,  don't worry about Ross really, really.(She hears the noise of the key in the  lock) Oh! Hide! That's Ross! Hide! Hide!
Gavin: Yeah! But you said not to worry about...
Rachel: I lied! And I'm not sick! Just stay behind the curtain!
Molly: Hi!
Rachel: Oh! Molly! You're not Ross.
Molly: No I'm here to take Emma to your mother's, remember?
Rachel: Right, right, yes!
Molly: Don't panic!
Rachel: What?
Molly: There is a man behind your curtain. I have a mace in my  purse.
Rachel: No! That's OK! That's OK! That's OK! No no no no! This is my  business associate Gavin. He's just being silly.Gavin come out from behind  that curtain!
Gavin: Hi! Gavin! Please to meet you. It was my idea to stand  there.
Molly: Hello! I just go and get Emma.
Rachel: OK.
Gavin: So hum...Why did I have to hide?
Rachel: I thought it was Ross.
Gavin: So what if it was? I thought there was nothing going on between  you two...
Rachel: There isn't. There is totally isn't.
Gavin: You hear a key in the hole and you jump like a young bronco coming  out of a chute for the first time. I used to be arodeo clown.
Rachel: All right. Look. Gavin...I...I guess I felt guilty that you were  here, which I shouldn't. You know Ross and I are not inany relationship  but...he is the father of my child, and you know we do live together and plus  there is just so muchhistory...you know it's just...I don't know, I'm sorry,  I'm just all over the place.
Gavin: It's OK. I know it's probably not my place but can I give you a  piece of advice?
Rachel: Yes
Gavin: I think you should talk to Ross about all this.
Rachel: People keep saying that. Oh I'm sorry Gavin
Gavin: Don't be. It's just bad timing.
Rachel: So seriously...rodeo clown?
Gavin: One of the best, ma'am, one of the best...

[Scene: Mike's piano bar]

Phoebe: "No time for losers, 'cause we are the champions of the  world...!" Thank you!
(Mike kisses Phoebe)
Mike: Oh she's my girlfriend. That's not just how we do it here. I got to  get a break and when we come back we've got Kennethsinging "I touch  myself"...I'm not here to judge!
Phoebe: Hi hi...Oh you have got to sing.
Monica: No I told you I can't.
Phoebe: But you would have so much fun and you have a really nice  voice.
Monica: What have you heard me sing?
Phoebe: All the time when you're cooking.
Monica: What?
Phoebe: Yeah you're always singing "Yummy yummy yummy, I've got love in  my tummy"
Monica: Yeah I do rock that one.
Phoebe: OK so isn't there a little part of you that wants to get up  there?
Monica: Just a little but...it's just so scary! I don't even know what I  would sing...
Mike: Well I've got a book around...
Monica: "Delta Dawn"

[Scene: Central Perk]

Ross: Hi! I could help not notice, but that's an unusual necklace
Woman: You already hit on me an hour ago
Ross: Right, so that's a firm "no". I cannot believe this, I just keep  striking out.
Chandler: I don't get it neither, I mean you're obviously desperate,  you're asking women how they want to be killed
Ross: This is great. Rachel's gonna keep kissing guys until she finds the  one she wants and I'm gonna die alone.
Chandler: By drowning or...?!
Michelle: Why would he break up with me?
Her friend: I don't know sweetie.
Michelle: All I ever wanted was just love him and have him love me back.  I mean, am I so unlovable?
Chandler: Well...
Ross: I know! (he stands)


[Scene: Piano bar]

Mike: All right, that was Kenneth with his much too literal rendition of  "I touch myself". Coming up next we've got Monicasinging "Delta  Dawn".
Monica: Wait wait! I can't sing in front of all these people.
Phoebe: Just pretend they're not even here! It's OK Monica, when that  spotlight hits you it so bright you won't see anyoneanyway.
Monica: Hi! I'm Monica and I'm gonna be singing "Delta Dawn""Delta  Dawn, what's that flower you have on? Could it be a faded rose from days gone  by? ..."
Phoebe: Can you totally see through her shirt ?
Mike: Like an X-Ray. Bad day not to wear a bra.
Monica: "To take you to his mansion in the sky-y?"

[Scene: Monica and Chandler's]

Joey: Hey, I need your help.
Chandler: Wow, it seems serious. What seems to be the problem, Ashley  Judd?
Joey: Look, I'll get new headshot taken, all right, so I want to get my  eyebrows shaped
Chandler: I am sorry, moment to make fun of that, please!
Joey: You may be a sissy but I'll still (pound you out on ground). All  right, it hurts so bad, I could only let her do oneeyebrow and now... they  dont match!
Chandler: Its like a baby caterpillar chasing its mama!
Joey: All right, look, you got to help me out, ok? Look, I have the magic  marker, I want you to fill in the skinny one soI dont look stupid for my  pictures.
Chandler: Ok. First of all, this is green!
Joey: What the hell am I supposed to do!
Chandler: All right, I will help you out but you have to promise me you  will not tell anyone what I am about to tell you.
Joey: What, what.
Chandler: Ok, you know how most kids get their allowance from mowing the  lawn or taking out the garbage, well I earned mineby plucking the eyebrows  of my father and his business partners.
Joey: Oh my God!
Chandler: Yeah, well, I guess you dont need my help Victor  Victoria!
Joey: Ok all right, no, no, no, no, I do, I do, I do, I need your help,  but Chandler I dont know if I can take anymoreplucking. It hurts so  bad!
Chandler: Oh, not with my combination of ice cubes, aloe Vera and my  gentle self-loathing touch.

[Scene: Piano Bar]

Monica: "Take me to the mansion in the sky-y". I am sorry, the song is  over. Did you see me out there?
Phoebe: Every little bit of you!
Monica: I cant believe I did this. I cant believe I'm singing for the  people, and they liked me! Hey, did you hear thatone shouting look at those  tips! I mean, did I really help you get a lot of tips?
Mike: Sure.
Phoebe: Mon', not that you didnt sound good, but...
Monica: Good? Didnt you hear them...I was great! Thank you so much for  making me do this. Thats is the best gift ever.
Mike: Also a good gift? Underwear.

[Scene: Ross']

Michelle: Thank you so much for letting me do this. Public bathrooms  freak me out, I can't even pee, let alone doanything else.
Ross: But, whats great is that you dont mind talking about it.
Michelle: Its so amazing I met you the same day that Eric broke up with  me, because its like you lose a boyfriend,you get a boyfriend.
Ross: Uh-ah!
Michelle: No dont worry, this is not some rebound thing. I am totally  over Eric.
Ross: (pfew). Good choice Ross.
Rachel: Oh, hey! Hi, there you are, Ive been looking for you  everywhere!
Ross: Oh, yeah, hello, well, now, here I am.
Rachel: Listen, my mum is not bringing the baby back until nine o clock.  So I was hoping you and I could have achance to kind of talk somebody  here?
Ross: Oh, yeah, yeah thats Michelle.
Rachel: Who?
Ross: Oh, just this woman Ive been seeing.
Rachel: Youve being seeing someone?
Ross: Yeah, didnt I mention that? Yeah, I mean, we havent being going  out for too long, but rather there is thisamazing connection between us. I-I  mean, in fact just before you came in she called me her boyfriend. I thought it  wasa little too soon, but it was also, you know, it was kinda nice.
Michelle: What are you taking amoxicillin for?
Ross: How great is this? You are already comfortable enough to look  through my stuff. Oh, I am sorry Michelle, thatsmy roommate, Rachel.
Rachel: Hi, and I am also Emmas mother.
Michelle: Ah, who is Emma?
Ross: I told you about my daughter.
Michelle: This is your daughter? I can be your new mummy!

[Scene: Monica and Chandler's]

Chandler: And done!
Joey: Oh my God! I didnt feel a thing ! Hey, are you still looking for a  job because you can tweeze circles aroundthat sadistic bitch at the  saloon
Chandler: Thanks. You wanna see what it looks like?
Joey: Yeah, yeah. Hey, they totally match! They look great! They look  great! How you doing!
Chandler: Yeah, yeah, I think it looks pretty good. I was a little  worried I was uncovering a birthmark right aboutthere, but it turned out to  be a little piece of chocolate.
Joey: Thank you so much.
Chandler: No problem.
Joey: Listen thats a pretty girly hour we just spent, we should add some  manly make up for it.
Chandler: Yeah.
Joey: Comb my eyelashes.

[Scene: Piano Bar]

Monica: Ok, for my next song I think Ill sing something a little more  upbeat. All right? Oh, how about the PointerSisters I am so excited. And  make it bouncy!
Phoebe: Oh youll probably take care of that on your hands.
Chandler: I am sorry I am late. Youll understand when youll see  Joey.
Monica: Honey, youre just in time, Im about to sing another  song!
Chandler: Really? In front of all this people?
Monica: And they love me!
Chandler: Oh my God!
Phoebe: Yes, she gives the people what they want.
Monica: All right, watch!
Monica: "Tonight's the night we're gonna make it happen, tonight we'll  put all other things aside. Give in thistime and show me some  affection..."
Chandler: Are those my wifes nipples?
Phoebe: Oh? Isnt that funny? I didn't see that before, I wouldn't have  let her go up again.
Chandler: I gotta stop this.
Monica: Oh, who cares, they still love me! "I am so excited..."
Chandler: You, touching yourself, out!

[Scene: Ross]

Rachel: Wow. She does that a lot!
Michelle: Ross, you didnt tell me you were a doctor!
Rachel: What, what, wait a minute! You havent even told her you were a  doctor, yet? How long have you known her, likean hour?
Michelle: Actually about an hour and a half.
Ross: I told you it wasnt long, but there is an amazing connection  between us.
Michelle: You feel that too? Oh, I thought that was just me!
Ross: Are you kidding?
Michelle: Hey, do you want to go away this weekend?
Ross: Well see.
Rachel: Ok, Ross, whats going on here, are we just bringing strange  women back to the apartment now?
Ross: I dont know, are we just kissing guys on balconies?
Rachel: How do you know about that?
Ross: Through the magic of sight! I was here, putting our child to  sleep...
Michelle: Emma.
Ross: When I happened to look through the window and I see you kissing a  guy you know, for what? A week?
Rachel: Oh, thats what this is all about? Did you bring her up here to  get back at me?
Michelle: No, actually, see I had to pee, cause I cant use public  bathrooms because the doodie parasites.
Ross: Ok, Michelle, its time to go.
Michelle: Well, call me!
Ross: Ok.
Michelle: No, wait, you dont have my phone number!
Ross: You know, if its meant to be, Ill guess it. Bye, bye.
Rachel: Score.
Ross: Oh, I am sorry, did you not like her, because I was hoping that we  could come to one of your kissing parties onthe balcony.
Rachel: Oh God, I cant believe youre making such a big deal about this.  It was one kiss, one guy, one time!
Ross: Oh, really!
Rachel: Yeah.
Ross: Oh, really!
Rachel: Oh yeah.
Ross: What about the guy from the bar?
Rachel: What? Who?
Ross: The guy you gave your number to.
Rachel: Whoa, how do you know about that?
Ross: Because he called here looking for you. So dont tell me  this...this kissing this guy from work is a one time thing,ok? Youve been  out there in bars and on balconies for over a month now. And you didnt even  have the courtesy to tell me.
Rachel: Why didnt I get that message?
Ross: What?
Rachel: From the guy in the bar, why didnt I get that message?
Ross: Because I folded it up and put in my pants pocket. Do you...do you  not look there?
Rachel: Ross?
Ross: I never gave it to you.
Rachel: Why?
Ross: I dont know.
Rachel: Oh God. You know what? Who you think you are? Who are you to  decide what messages I should or should not get?
Ross: Who am I?
Rachel: Yes.
Ross: I am the guy whos taking care of our baby while youre out at bars  meeting guys!
Rachel: Oh my God, I cannot believe this. You know I actually came in  here hoping to have a mature conversation with youAbout us! But I cant do  that with someone who hides my messages and brings crazy women back to my  apartment!
Ross: None of the sane ones wanted to come back with me! Thats not the  point. Ok? The point is you...you are the oneWho moved on and didnt tell  anyone!
Rachel: Oh, Ross, this is just so messed up! Whats wrong with us? You  know when people hear about our situation theyAlways ask, what, you live  together but youre not a couple? And you have a baby, isnt that weird? And I  say No.You know what, its not, because it works for us! But you know this  doesnt work. In fact this is the opposite of working!
Ross: Uh, clearly.
Rachel: And you know, we said that we would, we would live together as  long as this makes sense. An maybe this, you know,Just doesnt make sense  anymore.
Ross: Yeah, maybe not. So what you wanna do?

[Scene: Joey's]

Joey: Hey!
Rachel: Hi. Can Emma and I live here for a while?
Joey: Ha, oh, of course.
Rachel: Thank you.
Joey: Your eyebrows look weird.

[Ending Credits]

Chandler: Jeremiah was a bullfrog. Was a good friend of mine, never  understood a single word he said, but I helped himdrink his wine. So you  just touch yourself for anything?


END

lines.text: The One Where Ross Is Fine

lines.speaker: Written by
lines.text: Sherry Bilsing-Graham & Ellen Plummer

lines.speaker: Teleplay by
lines.text: Steven Rosenhaus

lines.speaker: Transcribed by
lines.text: PHDB (phdb2000@hotmail.com) and Sebastiano  (sebapop@libero.it)
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's]

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Yeah! Yeah! OK! Sure! Look! Can we...can we talk about what  happened here last night?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Sure! Just give me a second to get all huffy and weird like  you! Do you believe that who everdid something over here last night did what  they did or didn't do ...I mean come on!!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: OK you...you really don't know what I am talking about?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: OK! Last night after the party I saw Rachel kissing that jerk from  her office out on your balcony.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Our balcony? Seriously? That's so funny because I told Monica  we should put lights on our balcony. And she said"No, no. It's too cold,  nobody will go out there." And I said "Maybe if we put some light out there they  will"

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Right that's why I came over to talk about. Hum...I saw Rachel  kissing some guy on your balcony,even though there were NO LIGHTS !

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: So are you gonna...talk to her?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Why...Why should I? I mean if she wants to move on, that's  fine!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: You know when "That's fine" sounds true when someone yells it  and spits!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: No I'm serious. I mean she wants to date people? Fine! I don't care  but...at least she could have told me. You knowI...I've been putting my life  on hold and just concentrating on Emma but if she wants to go out there kissing  guys shebarely knows, then so will I ! Very funny! Ross is gay! Ah!  Ah!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: No no no. Good. So you're moving on? Do you have any idea where  you're moving?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I don't know. I mean I have plenty of opportunity. Just just now  there were some women at the coffee house smiled at me.And then the other  day on the subway a woman "accidentally" sat on my hand.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Dude, don't rub my face in your crazy single life!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Well, and how about this? There is an anthropologist at school who  totally came on to me during the inter-departmentalPotluck dinner.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Why did I get married?!
[Opening Credits]
[Scene: Central Perk]

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Hey! Let me ask you guys something. I have a new headshot taken  tomorrow right and the photographer said she thinks Ishould have my eyebrows  waxed. Is that weird for a guy?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Well it depends.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: On how far along he's in the sex change process!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: No I totally disagree. No I think it's fine for a guy to do  something like that. Such you an actor. Not that you need to,your eyebrows  are...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Ok! Stop it you guys! Stop staring! You're freaking me out!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Your knuckles are kinda hairy too...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh man! I have to get those done too?!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Wow! Talking about high maintenance

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Hey hey! You dye your hair!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: I'm a woman!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Arghhh! Double standards!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh before I forget, are you coming to Mike's piano bar  tonight?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Only if I don't have to get up and sing.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: But everybody sings. It's so much fun! Last time this adorable  old man got out there, forgot all of the words, flipped outand everyone  booed him off the stage. So funny.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: It's just, I'm not good at singing.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh! What's the matter? Are you scared? You're afraid I'm a better  singer? You're afraid I'm gonna beat you at singing?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: No no, it's not working on me. Wow! I must be growing up!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: OK fine! Please come and support Mike. You don't have to  sing.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: So I don't have to sing and I can just sit there and pass  judgments on others?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: While drinking...

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I'm there!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hi guys! Listen I really need your help. I think I did something  really stupid.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Well yes Rachel but you got something so beautiful out  there

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: No not that. I kissed Gavin last night.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: You kissed him?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah. It was after the party, we were on the balcony  and...

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Wait wait wait. I was at home the whole time. How did I missed  that?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: It was the end of the party, you were probably ironing wrapping  paper.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh yeah...So how did you end up kissing?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: You know we were all alone and he was being really nice to me  and, oh and he gave me this scarf...

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I thought you hated him?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: You know honey, there is a thin line between love and hate, and  it turns out that line...is a scarf!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: So are you thinking of starting up something with this  guy?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I don't know. It's so complicated. I work with this guy, you  know, I have the baby, and I have Ross, and I just...I don'tknow what to do  and I have to be at the office and see Gavin in ten minutes.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Sounds like you need to think about what you want, talk to Gavin,  and you definitely should talk to Ross

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Or...I could call in sick and not deal with it at all...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Wow! Five-month maternity leave, you're back for four days, kiss  a co-worker, call in sick, they are lucky to have you!!
[Scene: Beauty salon]

lines.speaker: Salon girl
lines.text: Hi

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Hey. I'm here for my eyebrow appointment.

lines.speaker: Salon girl
lines.text: Name?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Chandler Bing.

lines.speaker: Salon girl
lines.text: Ok. Very good. Have a seat right over here Mr. Bing and Sonia  will be right with you.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: OK Thanks.(Joey touches the hot wax). I touched the  stuff

lines.speaker: Sonia
lines.text: I'll take care of it

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Thanks. Do you get a lot of guys in here?

lines.speaker: Sonia
lines.text: Oh absolutely.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh good...

lines.speaker: Sonia
lines.text: Are you looking to meet somebody?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: All right let's just do this.

lines.speaker: Sonia
lines.text: We'll get to the wax in a minute. First I want to tweeze some of  the strays, ok? This may sting just a little bit...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Please I have an extremely high threshold...Holly Mother Of God! My  face! My face!! I'm all right! I'm all right!Just a little bit of shock  that's all but I'll be fine you can go again. I'm OK(He tries to avoid the  tweezers) Dammit! Woman!! How Hoooow!
[Scene: Central Perk]

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Hey it's the most eligible man in NY. How's the moving on  going?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Not well. I went on the subway again and someone did sit on my hand  but that person was neither female nor wearing pants.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Well maybe you're going about this the wrong way. You know I  mean think about it. Single white male, divorced three times,two  illegitimate children. The personal ad writes itself....

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: That's funny...Do you think you'll ever work again?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: What are doing? You know I can only dish it out!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I can't believe Rachel just moved on and didn't say anything to  me

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Maybe she didn't move on, you know...maybe that kiss was just  an impulsive one-time birthday thing

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: No no, about a month ago she gave her number to some guy in a  bar.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Did she go out with him?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: No. When he called, I...I threw the message away.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Ah! The high road...

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You know what? Enough! Enough talking! I have to get moving! Hey  check out those two blondes over there!Hey come with me!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Are you trying to get everybody divorced?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You don't have to do anything. It will just be easier if it is the  two of us, like college, remember? You...you break theice with some kind of  jokes so that they know you're the funny one and I swoop in with some  interesting conversation, sothey'll see that I'm the brilliant, brooding,  sexy one...

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I thought I had to make the jokes!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Don't you have to be at work?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Oh come on! Hello! Hi! My name is Chandler, here's my friend  Ross right here, and we were wondering you know if you're up for it. We only  need six more people for a human pyramid...Swoop!! Swoop!!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hum...So...hum...Oh hey I noticed you were reading the  paper...another flood in Europe? Heres a question: "Would you...would you  rather drown or be burnt alive?"

lines.speaker: Blonde girl
lines.text: Sorry...we were just leaving

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: We still got it!
[Scene: Ross']

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Who is it?

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: Gavin! I brought you some soup.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: I heard you were sick...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh! Right! Yeah! Hold on, I'll be just clean up in here a little  bit! Hello Gavin

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: I missed you at work today. How are you feeling?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I a not gonna lie to you, I'm pretty sick

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: Oh! Good! Because I was having a totally paranoid moment when I  thought you called in sick to avoid me.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh no no no

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: So I had fun last night

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: So did I

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: Exactly how contagious is this thing you have? I mean is it a cold  for standing on the balcony or did a monkey bite you?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: It's just a cold

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: Do you have fever? Let me see. Hum...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: What? What's the matter?

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: What's Ross doing to you on that picture?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh he's dusting me with a fossil brush. He thought it would be  funny.

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: Right. Right. Ross. So what's the deal with you guys? I don't want  to get in the middle of anything

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh you're not. You're not gonna get in the middle of anything,  don't worry about Ross really, really.(She hears the noise of the key in the  lock) Oh! Hide! That's Ross! Hide! Hide!

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: Yeah! But you said not to worry about...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I lied! And I'm not sick! Just stay behind the curtain!

lines.speaker: Molly
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh! Molly! You're not Ross.

lines.speaker: Molly
lines.text: No I'm here to take Emma to your mother's, remember?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Right, right, yes!

lines.speaker: Molly
lines.text: Don't panic!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Molly
lines.text: There is a man behind your curtain. I have a mace in my  purse.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: No! That's OK! That's OK! That's OK! No no no no! This is my  business associate Gavin. He's just being silly.Gavin come out from behind  that curtain!

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: Hi! Gavin! Please to meet you. It was my idea to stand  there.

lines.speaker: Molly
lines.text: Hello! I just go and get Emma.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: OK.

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: So hum...Why did I have to hide?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I thought it was Ross.

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: So what if it was? I thought there was nothing going on between  you two...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: There isn't. There is totally isn't.

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: You hear a key in the hole and you jump like a young bronco coming  out of a chute for the first time. I used to be arodeo clown.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: All right. Look. Gavin...I...I guess I felt guilty that you were  here, which I shouldn't. You know Ross and I are not inany relationship  but...he is the father of my child, and you know we do live together and plus  there is just so muchhistory...you know it's just...I don't know, I'm sorry,  I'm just all over the place.

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: It's OK. I know it's probably not my place but can I give you a  piece of advice?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yes

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: I think you should talk to Ross about all this.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: People keep saying that. Oh I'm sorry Gavin

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: Don't be. It's just bad timing.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: So seriously...rodeo clown?

lines.speaker: Gavin
lines.text: One of the best, ma'am, one of the best...
[Scene: Mike's piano bar]

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: "No time for losers, 'cause we are the champions of the  world...!" Thank you!
(Mike kisses Phoebe)

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Oh she's my girlfriend. That's not just how we do it here. I got to  get a break and when we come back we've got Kennethsinging "I touch  myself"...I'm not here to judge!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Hi hi...Oh you have got to sing.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: No I told you I can't.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: But you would have so much fun and you have a really nice  voice.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: What have you heard me sing?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: All the time when you're cooking.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Yeah you're always singing "Yummy yummy yummy, I've got love in  my tummy"

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Yeah I do rock that one.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: OK so isn't there a little part of you that wants to get up  there?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Just a little but...it's just so scary! I don't even know what I  would sing...

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Well I've got a book around...

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: "Delta Dawn"
[Scene: Central Perk]

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hi! I could help not notice, but that's an unusual necklace

lines.speaker: Woman
lines.text: You already hit on me an hour ago

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Right, so that's a firm "no". I cannot believe this, I just keep  striking out.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I don't get it neither, I mean you're obviously desperate,  you're asking women how they want to be killed

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: This is great. Rachel's gonna keep kissing guys until she finds the  one she wants and I'm gonna die alone.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: By drowning or...?!

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: Why would he break up with me?

lines.speaker: Her friend
lines.text: I don't know sweetie.

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: All I ever wanted was just love him and have him love me back.  I mean, am I so unlovable?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Well...

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I know! (he stands)
[Scene: Piano bar]

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: All right, that was Kenneth with his much too literal rendition of  "I touch myself". Coming up next we've got Monicasinging "Delta  Dawn".

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Wait wait! I can't sing in front of all these people.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Just pretend they're not even here! It's OK Monica, when that  spotlight hits you it so bright you won't see anyoneanyway.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Hi! I'm Monica and I'm gonna be singing "Delta Dawn""Delta  Dawn, what's that flower you have on? Could it be a faded rose from days gone  by? ..."

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Can you totally see through her shirt ?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Like an X-Ray. Bad day not to wear a bra.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: "To take you to his mansion in the sky-y?"
[Scene: Monica and Chandler's]

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Hey, I need your help.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Wow, it seems serious. What seems to be the problem, Ashley  Judd?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Look, I'll get new headshot taken, all right, so I want to get my  eyebrows shaped

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I am sorry, moment to make fun of that, please!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: You may be a sissy but I'll still (pound you out on ground). All  right, it hurts so bad, I could only let her do oneeyebrow and now... they  dont match!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Its like a baby caterpillar chasing its mama!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: All right, look, you got to help me out, ok? Look, I have the magic  marker, I want you to fill in the skinny one soI dont look stupid for my  pictures.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Ok. First of all, this is green!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: What the hell am I supposed to do!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: All right, I will help you out but you have to promise me you  will not tell anyone what I am about to tell you.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: What, what.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Ok, you know how most kids get their allowance from mowing the  lawn or taking out the garbage, well I earned mineby plucking the eyebrows  of my father and his business partners.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Yeah, well, I guess you dont need my help Victor  Victoria!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Ok all right, no, no, no, no, I do, I do, I do, I need your help,  but Chandler I dont know if I can take anymoreplucking. It hurts so  bad!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Oh, not with my combination of ice cubes, aloe Vera and my  gentle self-loathing touch.
[Scene: Piano Bar]

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: "Take me to the mansion in the sky-y". I am sorry, the song is  over. Did you see me out there?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Every little bit of you!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I cant believe I did this. I cant believe I'm singing for the  people, and they liked me! Hey, did you hear thatone shouting look at those  tips! I mean, did I really help you get a lot of tips?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Sure.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Mon', not that you didnt sound good, but...

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Good? Didnt you hear them...I was great! Thank you so much for  making me do this. Thats is the best gift ever.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Also a good gift? Underwear.
[Scene: Ross']

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: Thank you so much for letting me do this. Public bathrooms  freak me out, I can't even pee, let alone doanything else.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: But, whats great is that you dont mind talking about it.

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: Its so amazing I met you the same day that Eric broke up with  me, because its like you lose a boyfriend,you get a boyfriend.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Uh-ah!

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: No dont worry, this is not some rebound thing. I am totally  over Eric.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (pfew). Good choice Ross.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, hey! Hi, there you are, Ive been looking for you  everywhere!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, yeah, hello, well, now, here I am.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Listen, my mum is not bringing the baby back until nine o clock.  So I was hoping you and I could have achance to kind of talk somebody  here?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, yeah, yeah thats Michelle.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, just this woman Ive been seeing.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Youve being seeing someone?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Yeah, didnt I mention that? Yeah, I mean, we havent being going  out for too long, but rather there is thisamazing connection between us. I-I  mean, in fact just before you came in she called me her boyfriend. I thought it  wasa little too soon, but it was also, you know, it was kinda nice.

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: What are you taking amoxicillin for?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: How great is this? You are already comfortable enough to look  through my stuff. Oh, I am sorry Michelle, thatsmy roommate, Rachel.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hi, and I am also Emmas mother.

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: Ah, who is Emma?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I told you about my daughter.

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: This is your daughter? I can be your new mummy!
[Scene: Monica and Chandler's]

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: And done!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh my God! I didnt feel a thing ! Hey, are you still looking for a  job because you can tweeze circles aroundthat sadistic bitch at the  saloon

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Thanks. You wanna see what it looks like?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah, yeah. Hey, they totally match! They look great! They look  great! How you doing!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, I think it looks pretty good. I was a little  worried I was uncovering a birthmark right aboutthere, but it turned out to  be a little piece of chocolate.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Thank you so much.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: No problem.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Listen thats a pretty girly hour we just spent, we should add some  manly make up for it.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Comb my eyelashes.
[Scene: Piano Bar]

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Ok, for my next song I think Ill sing something a little more  upbeat. All right? Oh, how about the PointerSisters I am so excited. And  make it bouncy!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh youll probably take care of that on your hands.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I am sorry I am late. Youll understand when youll see  Joey.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Honey, youre just in time, Im about to sing another  song!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Really? In front of all this people?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: And they love me!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Yes, she gives the people what they want.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: All right, watch!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: "Tonight's the night we're gonna make it happen, tonight we'll  put all other things aside. Give in thistime and show me some  affection..."

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Are those my wifes nipples?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh? Isnt that funny? I didn't see that before, I wouldn't have  let her go up again.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I gotta stop this.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh, who cares, they still love me! "I am so excited..."

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: You, touching yourself, out!
[Scene: Ross]

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Wow. She does that a lot!

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: Ross, you didnt tell me you were a doctor!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: What, what, wait a minute! You havent even told her you were a  doctor, yet? How long have you known her, likean hour?

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: Actually about an hour and a half.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I told you it wasnt long, but there is an amazing connection  between us.

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: You feel that too? Oh, I thought that was just me!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Are you kidding?

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: Hey, do you want to go away this weekend?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Well see.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ok, Ross, whats going on here, are we just bringing strange  women back to the apartment now?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I dont know, are we just kissing guys on balconies?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: How do you know about that?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Through the magic of sight! I was here, putting our child to  sleep...

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: Emma.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: When I happened to look through the window and I see you kissing a  guy you know, for what? A week?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, thats what this is all about? Did you bring her up here to  get back at me?

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: No, actually, see I had to pee, cause I cant use public  bathrooms because the doodie parasites.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Ok, Michelle, its time to go.

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: Well, call me!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Ok.

lines.speaker: Michelle
lines.text: No, wait, you dont have my phone number!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You know, if its meant to be, Ill guess it. Bye, bye.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Score.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, I am sorry, did you not like her, because I was hoping that we  could come to one of your kissing parties onthe balcony.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh God, I cant believe youre making such a big deal about this.  It was one kiss, one guy, one time!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, really!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, really!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: What about the guy from the bar?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: What? Who?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: The guy you gave your number to.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Whoa, how do you know about that?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Because he called here looking for you. So dont tell me  this...this kissing this guy from work is a one time thing,ok? Youve been  out there in bars and on balconies for over a month now. And you didnt even  have the courtesy to tell me.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Why didnt I get that message?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: From the guy in the bar, why didnt I get that message?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Because I folded it up and put in my pants pocket. Do you...do you  not look there?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ross?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I never gave it to you.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I dont know.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh God. You know what? Who you think you are? Who are you to  decide what messages I should or should not get?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Who am I?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I am the guy whos taking care of our baby while youre out at bars  meeting guys!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh my God, I cannot believe this. You know I actually came in  here hoping to have a mature conversation with youAbout us! But I cant do  that with someone who hides my messages and brings crazy women back to my  apartment!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: None of the sane ones wanted to come back with me! Thats not the  point. Ok? The point is you...you are the oneWho moved on and didnt tell  anyone!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, Ross, this is just so messed up! Whats wrong with us? You  know when people hear about our situation theyAlways ask, what, you live  together but youre not a couple? And you have a baby, isnt that weird? And I  say No.You know what, its not, because it works for us! But you know this  doesnt work. In fact this is the opposite of working!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Uh, clearly.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: And you know, we said that we would, we would live together as  long as this makes sense. An maybe this, you know,Just doesnt make sense  anymore.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Yeah, maybe not. So what you wanna do?
[Scene: Joey's]

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hi. Can Emma and I live here for a while?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Ha, oh, of course.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Your eyebrows look weird.
[Ending Credits]

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Jeremiah was a bullfrog. Was a good friend of mine, never  understood a single word he said, but I helped himdrink his wine. So you  just touch yourself for anything?
END
